intro: Paederia villosa, commonly known as hairy paederia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy pubescence. Its small, white or greenish flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are followed by small, round berries. Paederia villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and gardens.
